alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Prairie and central Monroe Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holly Grove, or near Clarendon, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brinkley... Clarendon... De Valls Bluff... Fredonia... Allendale... Dobbs Landing... Peppers Landing... Hallsville... Keevil... Brasfield... Duncan... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
